snippet.title: Introducing New MCs Subaru and Kaguya in the Latest Trailer for Rune Factory: Project Dragon
snippet.description:
At the Marvelous Game Showcase 2024, Shiro Maekawa, the director of the Rune Factory series, introduced new earthmates who are the main characters in this game, Subaru and Kaguya. Players can choose one of them as the main character they will play, similar to previous Rune Factory titles.

What makes this trailer intriguing is that both Subaru and Kaguya showcase various action movements packaged in the "Art of Dance." Yes, you read that right, dancing. If earthmates from previous Rune Factory titles could communicate directly with their world through farming, in this spin-off title, you will save the world by dancing as "Earth Dancers." By using various musical instruments and weapons such as umbrellas, drums, swords, and more, both for combat and other activities. Additionally, besides being weapons, the umbrellas used can also be used as gliders for exploring the numerous islands in this game. Not only that, there are two new types of weapons, bows, and talismans, that you can use to confront various monster attacks.

Unfortunately, like the announcement for STORY OF SEASONS, although there is a trademark indicating the title of Rune Factory: Project Dragon as Guardians of Azuma, Marvelous chooses to stick with the tentative name and has not announced the platform or release date for this game yet.

Rune Factory: Project Dragon
